title: Only Caps (and small caps, no lower case) used starting in 2012 with Linux based Gimp
content:
This is from an ID card that we make but our computer crashed and we had to rebuild. We are using Gimp to build these cards and didn't realize it was a custom font.

The unique items are all Capital even lower case letters are caps but smaller.  
Most unique letters are A, N and numbers of 0, 7

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317105507im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screenshot_3689.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317105507im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ScreenshotNumbers_6031.png)

Thanks,  
Chad

Font: 

 Fox Small Caps 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317105507/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

author: scubasteve

comments.content: It must be **[Fox Small Caps](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317105507/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=T-26&ffam=FoxSmallCapsRegular%20-%20Regular&fid=fc9d55dc44a24215daae1c0789d8a31d&fsize=60&text=07%2F14%2F2004%20Blood%3A%20O%2B%20%7C%20Eyes%3A%20Blue%20%7C%20Nationality%3A%20American&wrap=2)** by T-26
Thank You soooo much. I looked forever. It was exactly "FoxSmallCapsRegular"
